text: I ordered a pizza and fingers. It was the nastiest food i ever tasted. The fingers was freezer burned. The cook was rude and the pizza was burnt. It deseves negative 100 stars or more
Just a second away from The Strip!  Cheap drinks, slots, keno, pizza... Heaven  Very friendly environment! Place to be

Very nice and cozy dive bar, but with one big distinction not often seen in such a type of bars - they have delicious food prepared by world class Italian trained chefs. The pizza and fried zucchini are great. We also grabbed a bucket of hot Buffalo wings with our beers and this was awesome  (8).

Eugenia, is the best! Pizza is great drinks are cheap. Extremely casual relaxed vibe with awesome service. Randomly came across this bar when I was driving around but glad I found it! Thanks again Eugenia!
This is easily my favorite dive bar in vegas. friendly staff, cheap drinks for being so close to the strip, and great music! my favorite bartenders are brian, tony and jenna. :)

As far as dive bars goes, this is the crown jewel. It rocks for drinks and the bartender Gina is a blast. An entertaining bunch of people in this place where the locals are local. I love drinks and the setup. Good prices, good pours, and super cool bartenders. I will be there again. Only minus is they dont serve food. You can get it next door but its much better if its all in one. Also the fod next door is Italian and Pizza mostly. So in a bar I want a bar burger and some calamari.. not pizza.. just fyi

See u there!
Best dive bar find ! We love supporting local businesses! Truly yummy pizza, salads, and pasta! We were there 3 times in just a couple days and will be back ! Friendly staff and good food!
The drinks are cheap, they let me charge my phone, and sometimes you get yelled at by a prostitute! 5 stars for an authentic Vegas experience!
Pizza is really good and the guys working are so nice!!! Music playing at the bar sucks, bring your own headphones

I love going to Motor City to visit old friends. Definitely a motley crew hangs out here. Great place for cheap drinks ($2 PBR and $4 Jameson shots...which is cheap for Vegas) and the bartenders are always ready to join you for a shot (my love to Brett, Fred, Scott, Daniella, Jena). If you are looking for a fancy-shmancy place...don't come here because they will laugh at you the minute you walk in. If you want a place to chill out, have an inexpensive drink and engage in some interesting conversation (usually about music) then you have found your Graceland.

One of the best pizza I have ever had. We asked for a crispy pizza and it was perfect. The staff was so friendly and the place is a nice to sit down and eat. Highly recommend it if looking for cheap and great meal

So apparently there are stand up comedians that are pitting there works up here at night. Me and my friends went bere around 11 o clock. And this stand up comedian started to have discrimantion jokes around me. Of course other people were laughing and some were worried that the jokes were going a little too far ahead. However, the experience that we had was awful, the comedian leaned against our table talking about stuff like if we dont understand. Apparantely i have lived in the U.S more than half of my life and i was able to understand what he qas saying. He said stuff like "i dont care what i even say because they are not going to understand me anyway" all the discrimination and stereotypes offended very well, if that was his point. As we were about to leave, he told us to continue our miserable life as an asian and we surely did not appreciate his comment. Hope this place does not have any stand up comedians who does not appreciates their own costumers.
Overall, the experience here was terrible thanks to him and i am definately sure that i am never going here again.
P.s. hopefully the owner hires stand up comedians who fully appreciates their customers and someome who is not a racist.
Thank you

This is another fun little dive. Cheap drinks, fun bartenders, a decent jukebox - what more could you need? 

On Thursdays, they have an open mic comedy show. The comics can be a little hit or miss, but they're more hit than miss most of the time! The host is great, he caters to folks there for the show, and even those who didn't know there would be a show at all. 

There's a decent pizza joint adjacent - it's definitely a step above ordinary bar food. 

Every time I've been there, I've had fun.

Located on the famous Las Vegas Restaurants Row this little dive bar is hidden in a strip mall offering live music,booze and bar food-appetizers,wings,fingers,subs and pizza.

Nothing much to look at, pretty small but a neighborhood bar for locals with decent food. The pizza could've been cooked a little longer-limp crust. The philly was cooked-ribeye steak with cheeze & onions,peppers and mushrooms.WHAT is with NOBODY using WHIZ!!!!

Not bad for a bar but nothing spectacular. Now that I know they deliver I might get some fingers and wings another time.

Motor City is located in a strip mall off Paradise. You'll miss it if you're not looking for it, as it is lost in the sea of neon signs. It's a typical Las Vegas bar, although it does have a stage area with seating. 

They do a lot of live music, and currently have a new bartender who is booking shows. I know her, as she is my very good friend!

Overall, this is a cool place to grab a drink, usually very quiet during the day and kind of busy at night and on the weekends. if you're looking for live music (metal, punk, etc) head down here.
Omg this place is low key , very comfortable environment. Pool table and there's a pizza place right next door . We had an amazing bar tender I think she's foreign and hott . Definitely recommend

This place makes the worst food I ever had in my life, and I have had prison food. Like prison food they use expired food products and then laugh about it, calling Americans stupid people who are weak ignorant that will eat anything

You know... I had to think long and hard about how to rate this place. I landed on four stars because, for what it is, the place excels. It's a dive for sure. Full of smoke and drunks. The moment I walked in there was a VERY drunk man starting a fight. I stuck it out though. The bartender dealt with it like a PRO. We had a drink and "enjoyed" the open mic night for a while.
I didn't have the food, but I have heard good things. 
I had to use the men's restroom because someone was sick in the women's... I have to say it is the cleanest smelling dive bar men's restroom I have ever been in.
I may go back for another round of open mic debauchery in the near future

I have spent many an eve in Motor City over the past 13 years. As a performer as MoonVine and with Monty Banks. It is a place where the hallway of dreams cross and meet to create vortex in the space-time continuum.

This video is a spontaneous collaboration of Mike Powers, Monty Banks, Doug De Nada and myself of a song we never performed before.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2gygx4PaTmY

No Kitchen anymore and Im glad we dont need food, just booze. A very chillax spot sometimes a band (GoldTop Bob) is great for blues night. DJ Swami is sometimes there spinning some old school vinyl while you shoot some pool. A fine place to kick back with some outtstown friends as well. Brett Rules!!!!!

There is a kitchen now, and they make bad ass chicken fingers with light fluffy  panko breading. The bartenders rock out I love Christy, and Mike. There is not much to this bar, but its good if you want good quality with out the crowds. Surprisingly they have some fancy unique types of booze. Like Cilantro vodka, and Jalape√±o. It can get crazy in there, and the people behind the bar seem more than willing to experiment with some of the weird stuff. This place is fun I guess... I like their little kitchen, I think its good for those who get a little too tips, they need a nibble.
